issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192:
Changed bin/mapred job -list to not print job-specific information not available at RM.

Very minor incompatibility in cmd-line output, inevitable due to MRv2 architecture.

fields.summary: AccessControlException when running mapred job -list command

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: client
components.description: Code for submitting and monitoring jobs

fields.description:
When the RM has a large number of jobs, {{bin/mapred job -list}} takes a long time as it visits each AM to get information like num-maps, num-reduces etc.

We should move all per-AM information to {{bin/mapred job -status}} and keep the list just a list.
fields.summary: Command line listJobs should not visit each AM

comments.body:
Attached patch removes maps/reduces count from "job -list" and thus avoids trips to each AM. I added this information instead in "job -status"

Also cleaned up the formatting of the list output. That was long due *smile*

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12511772/MAPREDUCE-3720-20120124.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestJobClientGetJob
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestMRWithDistributedCache
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestLocalModeWithNewApis

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1666//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1666//console

This message is automatically generated.

A quick look at the patch seems good, but this is undoing some of the work done by MAPREDUCE-2789.  Could you please confirm with Ramya that they are OK with these changes. Ramya filed MAPREDUCE-2789 and I just want to be sure that they get a heads up on the change.  I will try to review the patch more fully.

Thanks Robert. Yes, I did confirm offline with Ramya about this change before I even started this. The fact that we don't really have a choice because of the performance implications nails it, and she is okay with it as long as we surface it in job status.

Not a perfect solution, but there isn't a way out. We could add an option to print everything, say -verbose, but I'd like to defer it till it gets escalated.
I just committed this. Thanks Vinod!

    MAPREDUCE-3720. Changed bin/mapred job -list to not print job-specific information not available at RM. Contributed by Vinod K V.
